reviews.text: This is a good choice if you need to be in this area near SW Portland. I've tried several, and this has been the best by far. The hotel is quiet, and almost has more of a condo feel. The rooms on the man-made lake have nice balconies. The hotel has a restaurant on one end, breakfast included, and there are a number of other restaurants nearby. Amenities include a small indoor pool, and workout room.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Century Hotel during the holiday season and could not have been happier with the service and the room. The rooms are large, very comfortable, and quiet. My room overlooked the lake and the holiday decorations both inside the hotel and around the lake made it very festive. Plenty of parking is available, the hotel is conveniently located, and the restaurant, Hayden's Grill, was surprisingly good! I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: I was expecting this to be a fantastic hotel given the reviews I had read as well as looking through the hotel website. There were some good things such as the complimentary breakfast, a large room, nice view of the lake, a decent exercise room and close to where we needed to be for business. Unfortunately I think the not so good outweighed the positive aspects. The staff was ok but definitely did not go out of their way to welcome us or be helpful. Our room was dated and the bathroom was in major need of renovation (the bathtub, sink, floor tile and laminate counter were all cracking and chipped as well as rusty towel bars). I found it a little unsettling when we had a housekeeper cleaning our room as well as other rooms who was not wearing any kind of uniform what-so-ever. She had on sweats and a t-shirt and I didn't know she was working there until I saw her entering rooms with her housekeeping cart. There are not any snack vending machines (there is a drink machine) in the entire hotel so when we arrived late and needed something to eat we had to leave the hotel and drive around looking for something that was still open. The worst part was the extremely thin walls and the slamming of doors and loud conversation by the housekeeping and maintenance staff. This could be a great hotel with an improvement in staff and the guest room bathrooms.
reviews.title: Some good things and some not so good things!

reviews.text: This is just a great business hotel a few minutes south of the downtown Portland core (by car). Rooms are super comfortable and quiet and there is a nice community lake that the hotel sits on that you can stroll around. My room was unfortunately on the road side of the property instead of the lake but it was still plenty quiet after dark.
reviews.title: Nice. Very Nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff & great room! Our King room had a balcony & view of the lake! Very clean & spacious! Also, Hayden's Bar & Grill had excellent food!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We stayed her two nights recently and were pleased with the hotel and its amenities, as well as the location. Check-in was easy and our room was nice...didn't have a room looking out to the lake, but our friends did...very nice view! The property is located on a small lakefront with other business around the water as well...and a restaurant affiliated with the hotel is right off of the lake boardwalk as well...very pleasant view from the hotel and restaurant. Parking is ample, and the location to nearby areas and to Portland is great! Would definitely stay here again in the future ;))
reviews.title: Great Hotel with a great location!

reviews.text: We were thrilled to stay here on our way north. The reviews looked good and we were not disappointed. We had no idea the hotel had such a fabulous restaurant attached to it. We had a great meal and then walked back to our gorgeous rooms and slept very soundly in the wonderful beds.
reviews.title: A true gem! Great restaurant makes this an ideal hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and Istayed at this hotel last night while he went to a high school reunion at the attached restaurant. The layout of the room was very nice. It was clean and quiet. We had a room overlooking the small man-made lake in the back which was nice
reviews.title: Very Plain

reviews.text: The restaurant next door was very pricey for food that was very mediocre . It was $10 for a glass of wine and $11.50 for a two egg breakfast and the absolute worst latte I have ever had in my life. The extra annoyance was that there had been coupons tucked away in our electronic key case that no on bothered to alert us to. If we had known to use them the lower price tag would have made the so so food seem at least worth the price.
reviews.title: Absolutely Great!

reviews.text: So in all it was on OK place, but be sure to use those coupons because it was otherwise not worth it.
reviews.title: We recommend the Century for our out of town guests.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Century Hotel for a few nights before we had to fly out of Portland airport. We had a very nice room with a great view of the lake. The room was large and cozy and clean. The bathroom met all our needs. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions.
reviews.title: Great place for everyone

reviews.text: We happen to be there on a Friday evening when they had a farmers type market around the lake. There were vendors that sold food, fruit, veggies, and my favorite popcorn, all kinds of popcorn, we got the cheese popcorn. There was a band playing as well. It was a nice surprise.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate breakfast at Hayden's which is part of the hotel and it was very yummy.They had something on the menu to satisfy all of us, and the price was right.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, fantastic service!

reviews.text: The location was perfect for us, close to hwy 99 and right next to Interstate 5 and the 205.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL WITH A VIEW

reviews.text: You can't go wrong staying here.
reviews.title: wow, could not have been better

reviews.text: The Century Hotel offers one a break from a "chain" hotel sleep experience. Many rooms provide views of the man-made lake, while front facing rooms overlook a very busy highway through Tualatin. Room size is ample and come equipped with a blow-dryer, ironing board and 40" TV. At check-in guests receive a coupon for breakfast at Hayden's Grill, which is adjacent to the hotel. Be mindful guests must walk outside to reach the restaurant as the two are not interconnected. A Starbucks is within a five minute walk that requires crossing a very busy highway. The staff are friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. While WiFi is free, for those looking to use a "business center," this is one area in need of help. A single computer near the lobby is old, rather slow, and during my most recent visit, not working. The steel tubs become slippery, but if a rubberized bathmat was in the room I failed to locate it.
reviews.title: Great property and friendly staff.

reviews.text: This is a large, full-service, privately owned hotel, like we had in the old days before the proliferation of chain hotels. They are very accommodating - a fruit bowl becons you from the registration counter, newspapers are left at your door each morning, and a computer is available to print boarding pass or check your e-mail without charge. The rooms are large and have large screened TVs. Breakfast is included in the room rate with about 10 or so different options. We enjoyed being able to walk around the lake out the back door and even stopped to enjoy an Italian dinner at a restaurant across the lake as part of our walk. We have stayed here twice now and both times the service has been excellent and the personnel very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a Christmas tradition for us to spend Christmas night at the Century Hotel. We always stay in the same room (a lakeside suite) on the second floor. It is a nice quiet hotel and they offer a coupon for breakfast at Hayden's Grill adjacent to the hotel.
reviews.title: Elephants overhead

reviews.text: We entered the hotel and was greeted by a gal that was a little on the unfriendly side. Have to wonder if it was because she had to work on Christmas Day. Not very personable at all. That we can overlook.
reviews.title: Great secret of tualatin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite that we stayed in is on the second floor. Unfortunately for us, the hotel placed a family with two small children in the suite above us on the third floor. At 7:00 p.m. they all came into their room and the children ran and jumped over our living room. I called down to the front desk and the lady said she would call the people above us. We didn't hear anything from the front desk and the noise continued, so I called again. Was told that a family with two small children were above us and that they would be put to bed shortly. They did finally quiet down after about a half hour.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Portland for Biz or Lei!sure
